One property of continuously compounded rates of return is that they are additive
for multiple periods. Note that the (effective) holding period return over two years is
calculated by doubling the continuously compounded annual rate. If Rec = 10%, the
(effective) holding period return over two years is e (0.10)2 -1 = 22.14%. In general, the
holding period return after T years, when the annual continuously compounded rate is
Re, is given by:
HPRT = eRecXT -1
